medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe hypotonia and arthrogryposis with respiratory failure in two siblings.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Both siblings manifested symptoms at birth. The older brother exhibited severe hypotonia and arthrogryposis, dying of respiratory failure at 5 days of age. The proband, now 4.5 years old, has been mechanically ventilated since birth and has not achieved any developmental milestones.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Proband has a history of severe necrotizing enterocolitis with small intestine perforation at 2 months of age and progressive microcephaly.
medical_history.family_history: Both affected siblings are from a nonconsanguineous Yemeni Jewish family with reported carrier frequency of relevant gene mutation at 1:30 in healthy Yemeni Jews.
